Package br.com.kirgh.app.constraints

Annotation Interface DateValidation

@Target({FIELD,PARAMETER}) @Retention(RUNTIME) @Constraint(validatedBy=DateValidator.class) public @interface DateValidation
The code snippet is defining a custom annotation called DateValidation.

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    Class<?>[]
    groups
    This a method declaration within the DateValidation annotation.
    String
    message
    The String message() method within the DateValidation annotation is used to specify the error message that will be displayed when the validation fails.
    Class<? extends jakarta.validation.Payload>[]
    payload
    This is a method declaration within the DateValidation annotation.

  • Element Details

    • message

      String message
      The String message() method within the DateValidation annotation is used to specify the error message that will be displayed when the validation fails. In this case, the default error message is not a valid representation of a past date [yyyy-MM-dd]. This message will be shown if the annotated field or parameter does not represent a valid past date in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
      Returns:
      Default message related to this validation.
      Default:
      "not a valid representation of a past date [yyyy-MM-dd]"

    • groups

      Class<?>[] groups
      This a method declaration within the DateValidation annotation. It is used to specify the validation groups to which the annotation belongs.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an array of Class
      Default:
      {}

    • payload

      Class<? extends jakarta.validation.Payload>[] payload
      This is a method declaration within the DateValidation annotation. It is used to specify the payload types that can be attached to the validation constraint.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an array of Class
      Default:
      {}
